citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The facility self-reported a deviation in a protocol previously approved by the Institutional Animal Care and Use
Committee (IACUC) in a letter to the Office of Laboratory Animal Welfare (OLAW), upon which the USDA was also
included. On December 2, 2024, an ocular study involving 43 rabbits was IACUC-approved for a 90 second exposure
duration, however the calculation for the elapsed exposure time was inadvertently not updated from 120 seconds in the
Excel spreadsheet used on previous studies. Failure of staff to update the exposure time in the Excel spreadsheet
resulted in the deviation from the IACUC-approved protocol. Additionally, a male rabbit was inadvertently introduced into
the study, which had been specifically approved for female rabbits only, resulting in a need to repeat the study. Medical
records evaluated by the USDA inspector for the affected animals did not indicate any untoward effects to the animals
from this deviation in the protocol. The facility has a standard ocular exposure study which uses 120 seconds of exposure.
This particular study was requested and approved for 90 seconds of exposure, which was where the accidental deviation
originated.
In response to the incident, the IACUC implemented and approved the following corrective actions: use of locking
spreadsheet calculators, version control of study forms, and quality control along with using a revised chart for study
directors. Additionally, two individuals will now be involved in the study flow and the charts outlining the sexing of rabbits
have been updated with additional information. Staff have been informed of these changes.
Correct by May 29, 2025, onward. Corrective actions by the facility have been taken prior to the time of inspection.
This inspection was conducted with the IACUC Vice Chair and a Clinical Veterinarian. The exit interview was conducted
with the Attending Veterinarian, Clinical Veterinarians, IACUC representatives, and additional facility representatives via
Teams.
